artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: man at left wearing blue kimono with pants with medium and light blue floral medallions on white, pointing a spear at a partially kneeling man who holds the end of the staff in his PR hand; kneeling man wears a blue and grey geometric patterned kimono; snowy landscape at left
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Censor seal: 申五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
text: Actors Kitaoka Nizaemon VIII as Kakogawa Honzō (R) and Kataoka Gadō II as Ōboshi Rikiya (L). Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Ninth Act
